## My current favorite equation is: {background="#C0C0C0"}

### the likelihood contribution for a single rank of $m_{kt}$ competitors

$$
L_{kt}=p(Y_{1kt}>Y_{2kt}>…>Y_{m_{kt}kt}|\theta_{t})=\prod_{i=1}^{m_{kt}-1}\frac{exp(\theta_{it})}{\sum_{l=1}^{m_{kt}}exp(\theta_{lt}),}
$$

where $Y_{1kt},Y_{2kt},…,Y_{m_{kt}kt}$ represent the latent performances of $m_{kt}$ competitors in game $k$ in time period $t$ and $\theta_{t}$ represent the vector of competitors abilities $m_{kt}$ competitors in game $k$ in time period $t$.
